definitions: To act or behave toward (someone or something) in a specified way.
To regard or consider (someone or something) in a specified way.
To apply a process or a substance to (something) in order to protect, preserve, or improve it.
To deal with (a disease, injury, or person) in order to relieve or cure.
To provide (someone) with food, drink, or entertainment at one's own expense.
examples: He treated the situation as a joke.
The wood was treated with a preservative.
I'll treat you to dinner tonight.
